item.title: Cozy farming life simulation game Fourleaf Fields announced for PC
item.content:encoded:
• PC

Farming reimagined from a miniature perspective.

Publisher HypeTrain Digital and developer BEHEMUTT have announced Fourleaf Fields, a cozy farming life simulation game in a tiny world. It will be available for PC via Steam. A release date was not announced.

Here is an overview of the game, via HypeTrain Digital:

About

In Fourleaf Fields, the familiar world of farming is reimagined from a miniature perspective. Grow towering crops, care for cute farm bugs, and uncover a web of secrets fueled by gossip—solo or online with friends.

Key Features

  • Grow Your Tiny Farm – Shoot huge water drops to water your crops, slice enormous carrots and pumpkins into pieces to harvest them, and care for your farm animals—moths, bees, butterflies, and ladybugs. Farming has never felt so fresh from this new, tiny perspective!
  • Uncover Secrets Through Gossip – Collect stories, connect the dots, and uncover the hidden secrets of your neighbors and the town’s mysterious past through the unique Gossip System—a tech tree fueled by hearsay.
  • Build Relationships and Grow the Town – Connect with charming neighbors, spark heartwarming events, and even help lonely hearts find each other. As your bonds deepen, raise the Town Rank to unlock new shops, upgrades, and breathe more life into the village.
  • Explore a Giant World – Roam forests, mountains, and everyday human items that feel enormous when you’re bug-sized—from towering boots to oversized teacups!
  • Play Solo or With Friends – Enjoy cozy adventures solo or with up to four players in a world of farming, exploration, and discovery!
